results.title: Kaante
results.creator_credit: Pritish Nandy Communications, Raju Patel and Sanjay Gupta
results.brief_description: This Bollywood remake of “Reservoir dogs” (Tarantino, 1992) is a lot of fun to watch with its musical numbers and an inventive reworking of the central narrative about a gang of criminals who are infiltrated by an undercover cop. After pulling off a daring bank robbery, and lucky escape from the law, the band retreat to sniff out the nark among them. Featuring sprightly performances by Amitabh Bachchan, Sanjay Dutt, Suniel Shetty, Mahesh Manjrekar, Lucky Ali and Kumar Gaurav, the narrative also addresses ethnic stereotyping as the crew lament their treatment at the hands of the Los Angeles Police Department.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Pritish Nandy Communications, Raju Patel and Sanjay Gupta

results.title: Ka Rorn: southern village
results.creator_credit: Arch Nicholson, Thanom Soongnarata, John Morris and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our Asian Neighbours: Thailand”.
At 3am the village of Ka Rorn comes to life and work begins. Produce must be taken to market in Phuket, the only major town on the island. Ka Rorn is a tight, relaxed, self-sufficient community of about 30 families. The people grow coconuts and fruit to sell in the market but, being an island village, fishing is the most lucrative industry.

results.title: Ka-wayawayama: Aeroplane Dance
results.creator_credit: Christina Pozzan, Jan Wositzky, Trevor Graham and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Records the story of “Ka-wayawayama” or “Aeroplane Dance” of the Yanuwa people of the Borroloola area in the Northern Territory. The dance was created after an American “Liberator” bomber crashed in the area in 1942, after a mission in the South-west Pacific. Re-creates the plight of the flight crew in their trek across inhospitable terrain across the Gulf of Carpentaria and the search for the lost crew.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Christina Pozzan, Jan Wositzky, Trevor Graham and Film Australia

results.title: K.C.I.: beyond the three r's
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Silva Basmajian, Arthur Ham and Scott Barrie
results.brief_description: Kitchener Waterloo Collegiate and Vocational School embodies some of the best features of public secondary education today. The school encourages students to learn beyond the classroom through innovative programs like Cooperative Education or Community Involvement, and welcomes adults into the school to complete their education or upgrade their skills. Through candid views of school activities, classroom discussions, and interviews with staff and students, the film takes its audience through a busy day at a large urban high school. It approaches many of the questions in the current debate on education.

results.title: K-Rad Man
results.brief_description: A Mad Scientist creates the ultimate computer virus and locates a suitable test subject: K-Rad Man - to whom he can expose the computer virus and gauge its results.
